item.title: Hypertension
item.description:
title: “Hypertension (High Blood Pressure)” draft: false

Hypertension is a long-term medical condition in which the blood pressure in the arteries is persistently elevated.

Symptoms

  • Often no symptoms (it can be “silent”)
  • Headaches
  • Shortness of breath
  • Nosebleeds (less common)

Risks

  • Heart attack
  • Stroke
  • Kidney disease

When to see a doctor

If you have high blood pressure readings or symptoms such as chest pain, shortness of breath, or severe headache, contact a healthcare professional.

item.title: What is Angioedema?
item.description:
Overview

Angioedema is a swelling of the deeper layers of the skin, often affecting the face, lips, tongue, throat, hands, feet, or genitals. It may occur suddenly and can be potentially serious if it affects breathing.

Causes

  • Allergic reactions (foods, medications, insect stings)
  • Non-allergic drug reactions (for example, ACE inhibitors)
  • Hereditary angioedema (genetic forms)
  • Idiopathic (no clear cause)

Symptoms

  • Sudden swelling under the skin
  • Swelling of lips, eyelids, tongue, or throat
  • Pain or discomfort in the swollen area
  • Sometimes hives (urticaria) on the skin
